newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai stocks drop 2.00 pct on budget worries.
newsitem.headline: Thai stocks drop 2.00 pct on budget worries.

text.p: Thai stocks dropped 2.0 percent on Wednesday in a delayed reaction to budget deficit figures for the first quarter, analysts said.
There were also concerns some finance companies were struggling to honour short term debt paper, analysts said.

The SET Index fell 2.00 percent, or 16.85 points, by 0807 GMT to 835.78. The SET 50 was down 1.35 points, or 2.13 percent, to 63.00. "I think there was some initial doubts as to whether the budget figures were right, but now they seem that they are there are worries about the figures tomorrow," said a senior analyst at a European broker.

Figures for the first three months of this fiscal year showed the Thai government had run a budget deficit of 54 billion baht. The Bank of Thailand is due to release monthly economic data on Thursday. The market recovered slighty by 0835 GMT when it was down 13.21 points to 829.42.
There was market talk that a major finance company was struggling to meet its upcoming obligations on a promissory note, traders said.
Finance stocks were heavily sold as a result and there was selling of communications stocks after recent gains, he said.
Finance One topped the active list and was limit down dropping four baht to 37.00, Thai Farmers Bank was down two to 126 baht and Thai Telephone was off 2.25 to 24.25.
